wikipedia_page.main: Sir John Haslam (27 February 1878 – 21 May 1940) was a Conservative Party politician in England.  He was Member of Parliament (MP) for Bolton from the 1931 general election until his death in 1940, aged 62.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1931 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the 1935 United Kingdom general election

response: The Bolton by-election of 1940 was held on 13 September 1940.  The by-election was held due to the death of the incumbent Conservative MP, John Haslam.  It was won by the Conservative candidate Edward Cadogan, who was unopposed due to the War-time electoral pact.
*John Haslam  For political and public services in Lancashire.
